Tomato___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.organic_treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides and use disease-free seeds.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.chemical_treatment: Use streptomycin-based bactericides under agronomist guidance.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation and rotate crops with non-solanaceous plants.

Tomato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark concentric rings on older leaves causing defoliation.
Tomato___Early_blight.organic_treatment: Spray neem oil or a baking soda solution on affected leaves.
Tomato___Early_blight.chemical_treatment: Use chlorothalonil or mancozeb fungicides as recommended.
Tomato___Early_blight.prevention: Remove infected leaves and maintain crop spacing for good airflow.

Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Large irregular brown patches with white mold growth on undersides of leaves.
Tomato___Late_blight.organic_treatment: Use copper-based organic fungicides; ensure proper drainage.
Tomato___Late_blight.chemical_treatment: Apply metalaxyl or cymoxanil-based fungicides under supervision.
Tomato___Late_blight.prevention: Avoid leaf wetness and practice crop rotation.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Pale green or yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces with fuzzy olive mold underneath.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.organic_treatment: Spray potassium bicarbonate solution and improve air circulation.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.chemical_treatment: Apply chlorothalonil-based fungicides at first symptom appearance.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.prevention: Ensure greenhouse ventilation and avoid overhead watering.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small circular spots with dark margins on lower leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.organic_treatment: Use compost tea or neem oil sprays weekly.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Remove infected leaves and avoid working with wet foliage.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.symptoms: Tiny yellow specks and fine webbing under leaves.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.organic_treatment: Spray with neem oil or insecticidal soap.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.chemical_treatment: Use miticides like abamectin or bifenthrin as per label directions.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.prevention: Maintain proper humidity and introduce natural predators (ladybugs).

Tomato___Target_Spot.symptoms: Dark brown lesions with concentric rings on leaves and stems.
Tomato___Target_Spot.organic_treatment: Apply copper hydroxide sprays weekly until controlled.
Tomato___Target_Spot.chemical_treatment: Use difenoconazole-based fungicides as per guidance.
Tomato___Target_Spot.prevention: Avoid continuous tomato cropping and remove debris after harvest.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.symptoms: Upward curling yellow leaves and stunted growth.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.organic_treatment: Introduce beneficial insects to control whiteflies.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.chemical_treatment: Use imidacloprid or thiamethoxam for vector control.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties and control whiteflies early.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled light and dark green leaf patterns with curling.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.organic_treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants immediately.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.chemical_treatment: No chemical cure; disinfect tools and equipment.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Use resistant cultivars and wash hands before handling plants.

Tomato___healthy.symptoms: Green, uniform leaves with no visible signs of infection.
Tomato___healthy.prevention: Maintain good crop management and regular monitoring.
